intro: Meliosma brenesii, commonly known as the Mexican ghost tree, is a member of the Meliaceae family, characterized by its unique botanical features. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in the understory of tropical forests. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in panicles, and it produces woody capsules as its fruit. The species is notable for its ability to thrive in shaded environments and its role in supporting local biodiversity.
